channel.title: Would you change the combat system?
channel.description:
What do you not like about the RSC combat system? What is overpowered? Underpowered? Are there any major changes you would make to it?
I'm pretty sure we can all agree that god spells are overpowered... Especially since you can hit 20+ at level 15.

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

[quote=“nacional, post:17, topic:418616”]combat system is so dull imo. At least wish devs would make other melee weapons not be useless. Instead of r2h everywhere people would use
scim for higher acc but lower str and spears could be vice versa etc.[/quote]
That’s what I’m doing because I feel the same way. For example, I made maces have really high strength + a prayer bonus but extremely inaccurate.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you change the combat system?

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:2, topic:418693”]Flip the sprite of the ranger. So that the melee person is hitting them in the back. Add the bow if its not there. Does that sound right? Would look like shit imo.

^
Just noticed me and cleako thought of the same thing.[/quote]
Yeah sounds silly haha.

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:418693”]AttackHandler starts the RangeEvent (or at least it does on RSCE) and then it checks if they’re in combat each time it ranges. If they are, the RangeEvent is ended… or it might be when you’re attacked it checks to see if a RangeEvent is running and stops it. Either way, find out where it’s stopped and remove that check and it will continue ranging but as already said the sprites will need to be done to make it realistic. You would also need to adjust the combat so the person ranging doesn’t generate hits from the combat formula but instead through the range formula. How you’d go about handling it after your opponent runs is up to you, I presume it would just stop or automatically start ranging again when you’re allowed to re-attack?

Honestly, RSC wasn’t really designed for this and it seems tacky.[/quote]
Yeah it probably would be tacky. I just wanna experiment. I’m just gonna delete the end range event like you said and not bother with a sprite for now…

Read full topic
item.source: Would you change the combat system?

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

^ and what files would you use to make it keep shooting?

Read full topic
item.source: Would you change the combat system?

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“A Gh0st, post:10, topic:418616”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=521149.msg3786766#msg3786766 date=1318952664]

[quote author=A Gh0st link=topic=521149.msg3786760#msg3786760 date=1318952189]

It would not look great with 2D sprites if the attackers both stood in the same spot. You would have to have the camera show the victim as having their back to the second attacker while the first attacker faces the victim.
[/quote]You’d have to make the client change the actual position of the player when they spin the camera because there isn’t enough room on a tile to add an additional attacker.

I would be pretty impressed if someone could actually pull this off without it looking like rubbish.

What about the idea of a crossbow that ranges during the 3hit system so you don’t have to switch to a weapon?
[/quote]Does it hide the crossbow when you’re in combat?

If not, then it would be trivial.

I honestly do not understand your comment. What about it would be trivial? Having the crossbow disappear yet still fire bolts? Or making an animation sprite for the crossbow that fires bolts?

Either way, I would rather see a crossbow that shoots bolts in combat and does not disappear.[/quote]Making a crossbow still shoot in combat is easy.

I’m assuming it would be more difficult to get the crossbow to actually display in combat. You’d have to draw sprites and probably some other stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you change the combat system?

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

The main problem is that very few are even able to implement such a task in java.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you change the combat system?

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

[quote=“nacional, post:11, topic:418616”]I’ve always thought it’d be cool to have the triangle combat system of rs. Where you would wield the bow/cbow or the staff
and still hit 3 times with the range>mage , melee> mage, melee> range system. But not many support this notion.[/quote]
I think people just have no idea how this would be possible without completely changing the combat system… It just seems really complex.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you change the combat system?

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=521149.msg3786751#msg3786751 date=1318950913]

It would not look great with 2D sprites if the attackers both stood in the same spot. You would have to have the camera show the victim as having their back to the second attacker while the first attacker faces the victim.
[/quote]You’d have to make the client change the actual position of the player when they spin the camera because there isn’t enough room on a tile to add an additional attacker.

I would be pretty impressed if someone could actually pull this off without it looking like rubbish.

What about the idea of a crossbow that ranges during the 3hit system so you don’t have to switch to a weapon?
[/quote]Does it hide the crossbow when you’re in combat?

If not, then it would be trivial.[/quote]
I honestly do not understand your comment. What about it would be trivial? Having the crossbow disappear yet still fire bolts? Or making an animation sprite for the crossbow that fires bolts?

Either way, I would rather see a crossbow that shoots bolts in combat and does not disappear.

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:4, topic:418616”]Combat that supports multiple mele attackers would be a change, even if only in certain areas as in RS2. You can already be multi-attacked with one person ranging/casting while the other is in mele combat.[/quote]Would look retarded…

Read full topic

@cleako wrote:

Combat that supports multiple mele attackers would be a change, even if only in certain areas as in RS2. You can already be multi-attacked with one person ranging/casting while the other is in mele combat.

item.title: Would you change the combat system?
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

waj:

Not to sound like a dick, but with the threads for help you have been creating in the past few weeks, you have no chance of “editing/tweaking” the combat system.

Yeah I probably can’t at the moment. But it doesn’t mean it isn’t a good idea to start thinking about it. And I just wanted to get some discussion going.

Read full topic
